important_phrase: Local oil production   increased slightly and Gulf of Mexico crude inventories stayed near the top of   their average range for this time of year
New home construction softened further from already low levels

Private payroll employment improved   slightly in July, although many businesses continued to note a strong preference   for increasing existing staff hours and using part-time or temporary staff   rather than hiring full-time employees
Businesses cited   difficulties receiving credit and many firms expressed little or no interest in   applying for new loans because of low expectations for future sales or orders
However, railway companies described slower growth in motor vehicles,   chemicals, and housing-related shipments
New home construction softened further from already low levels
District automobile dealers indicated that sales increased from   a year ago
The outlook among contacts is moderately positive
Despite these concerns, contacts predict   continued growth in the coming quarter
The outlook among contacts is moderately positive

Contacts in Hartford and Portland both are   increasingly pessimistic concerning the outlook based on weak forecasts for job   growth, while a Providence contact sees potential for significant positive   absorption in the downtown office market based on deals currently under   discussion
Outlooks are cautious or cautiously   optimistic
Revenues in the   livestock sector improved as dairy, hog, and cattle prices increased
Credit conditions improved   slightly
Similar to the previous   reporting period, wage pressures increased only modestly
Credit conditions improved slightly   from the previous reporting period
Contacts indicated it was difficult to gauge the   extent of the recent softening as July and August, in general, tend to be   slower
Both new and existing home sales declined, with foreclosed homes coming   onto the market at a heightened pace
Consumer spending increased from the   previous reporting period
Stffing levels are steady, and little hiring is expected in the near   future
Construction volume remains weak
The market for business lending remains soft,   with bankers generally characterizing the demand for new commercial and   industrial loans as steady or slowly improving
Construction volume remains weak
Reports by nonresidential builders indicate some improvement in construction   activity since our last report
Purchases rose slightly on a year-over-year basis
Drilling service companies noted   solid demand and improved margins
Expectations are for continued modest improvement
On a more positive   note, there were scattered reports of hiring activity
Deposit growth was strong, and credit quality on outstanding loans was stable
Outlooks were cautiously optimistic
Nonresidential construction remains weak
Expectations are for continued modest improvement
Agricultural conditions improved since the   last survey period
Manufacturing production was flat, and factory orders declined slightly
The downward trend in overall retail prices in recent surveys flattened out   slightly, and most contacts expected steady prices heading forward
Bankers reported steady loan demand, stable   deposits, and an unchanged outlook for loan quality
Manufacturing   activity slowed in late July and August, while other business activity continued   to expand
Housing starts declined, with several   builders noting continued financing difficulties
Auto sales also increased slightly from the previous period, and nearly   all dealers were optimistic about future sales
Agricultural activity increased
Overall prices increased modestly
Overall prices increased modestly
) showed strong increases in manufacturing activity in Minnesota and South   Dakota, and slight increases in North Dakota
Commercial construction was   slow
Retail spending increased   moderately
Of Districts commenting on wages,   most identified little or no upward pressures or increases
The   reports from Boston and Cleveland also pointed to positive developments or net   improvements compared with the previous reporting period
Lending standards were largely unchanged
Manufacturing activity expanded further on   balance, although the pace of growth appeared to be slower than earlier in the   year
Cleveland noted improved construction activity for industrial use   and educational infrastructure; this raised overall activity above year-earlier   levels and prompted modest hiring by builders
Airline traffic was stable to up, with Boston pointing to an expanded number of   low-fare carriers
Residential real estate sales   markets weakened to very low levels, though New York City's rental market   continued to improve modestly
Respondents indicate a tightening of credit   standards for all categories--particularly in the commercial mortgage category

Non-manufacturing firms report ongoing improvement in   general business conditions and continue to report moderate increases in   employment; they remain fairly optimistic about the near term outlook
Vaancy rates were steady throughout most of the District, though   they increased modestly in Manhattan and the Albany area
Contacts report steady to   modestly declining selling prices and acquisition costs
Service-sector firms   reported mostly flat or very slight increases in activity since mid-summer
Construction firms gave mixed reports on   prices, with some noting steady materials costs and some indicating increases   for a variety of materials
Commercial bank officers indicated that credit quality   has been steady or has improved slightly since the last Beige Book
" Another said, "Investment spending is not increasing   because of concern about tax increases on business owners
Residential real estate contacts expect sales to remain   slow during the fall and winter
Some merchants noted   relatively healthy sales of apparel and small appliances, albeit with   significant discounting, but weak sales of big-ticket consumer electronic   products
In Wst Virginia, pasture conditions ranged from very poor to   excellent, but most fields were reported to be in fair to poor condition
Price growth slowed slightly at services   firms in recent weeks, according to survey respondents
However, survey respondents from most   manufacturing industries indicated continued mild expansion of employment and   weekly production hours, but average wages slowed
Banking was widely described by contacts as weak   and relatively unchanged since our last assessment
Price growth slowed slightly at services   firms in recent weeks, according to survey respondents
Most Realtors said that the high-end market   was extremely sluggish and often limited to corporate relocations
However, contacts at other dealerships reported a slowdown in sales
Demand   remained strong for agricultural products and improved further for natural   resources used for energy production
Demand for services improved modestly on balance but remained lackluster   overall
Reports indicated that   most businesses remain cautious in their approach to hiring and continue to rely   on improved productivity rather than increased employment as a means to expand   output
Although contacts noted slight improvements   in overall credit quality, lending standards stayed relatively restrictive for   business and consumer lending
Activity at petroleum refineries rose in response to increased demand,   although inventories remained at elevated levels
Despite sluggish sales activity, home prices edged up   further in some parts of the District
Demand for services improved modestly on balance but remained lackluster   overall
Generally, development   of the District's major crops remained ahead of its 5-year average pace
Meanwhile,   credit standards for consumer loans were basically unchanged, while demand for   these loans was mixed, ranging from weaker to moderately stronger
Meanwhile,   credit standards for consumer loans were basically unchanged, while demand for   these loans was mixed, ranging from weaker to moderately stronger
Firms in the transportation, business support,   telecommunications, and government services industries expanded existing   operations and hired new employees
However,   over the same period, sales increased 19 percent in Louisville and 5 percent in   Little Rock
A slight majority of the car dealers surveyed   reported that their inventories were too low, while 12 percent reported that   their inventories were too high
